p: Microalgae produce a suite of biochemical molecules, including carbohydrates, proteins, lipids, and nucleic acids, as well as essential vitamins and minerals. The cellular content of each fraction varies according to the specific strain of algae and their physiological responses to biotic and abiotic factors, e.g., light intensity, photoperiod, temperature, nutrients, and growth phase [ 43, 44]. The primary biochemical compositions of selected species of microalgae are shown in Table 2.
